[{"uid": "sn35.23", "root_name": "Sabbasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 35.23", "blurb": "The \u201call\u201d consists of the six interior and exterior sense fields.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn35.24", "root_name": "Pah\u0101nasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 35.24", "blurb": "The \u201call\u201d consisting of the six interior and exterior sense fields should be given up.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn35.25", "root_name": "Abhi\u00f1\u00f1\u0101pari\u00f1\u00f1\u0101pah\u0101nasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 35.25", "blurb": "The \u201call\u201d consisting of the six interior and exterior sense fields should be given up by understanding.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn35.26", "root_name": "Pa\u1e6dhamaaparij\u0101nanasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 35.26", "blurb": "Without understanding the \u201call\u201d consisting of the six interior and exterior sense fields and becoming dispassionate towards it, it is impossible to be free of suffering.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn35.27", "root_name": "Dutiyaaparij\u0101nanasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 35.27", "blurb": "Without understanding the \u201call\u201d consisting of the six interior and exterior sense fields and the associated consciousness and becoming dispassionate towards it, it is impossible to be free of suffering.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn35.28", "root_name": "\u0100dittasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 35.28", "blurb": "The \u201call\u201d consisting of the six interior and exterior sense fields is burning. This is the famous \u201cthird sermon\u201d taught at Gay\u0101\u2019s Head to the followers of the three Kassapa brothers.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn35.29", "root_name": "Addhabh\u016btasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 35.29", "blurb": "The \u201call\u201d consisting of the six interior and exterior sense fields, and the phenomena they condition, is weighed down.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn35.30", "root_name": "Samuggh\u0101tas\u0101ruppasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 35.30", "blurb": "The way to uproot all conceivings is to not conceive in relation to the six sense fields.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn35.31", "root_name": "Pa\u1e6dhamasamuggh\u0101tasapp\u0101yasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 35.31", "blurb": "The way to uproot all conceivings is to not conceive in relation to the six sense fields.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn35.32", "root_name": "Dutiyasamuggh\u0101tasapp\u0101yasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 35.32", "blurb": "The way to uproot all conceivings is to investigate the six sense fields as impermanent, etc.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}]

blurb: A second partial translation of the Saṁyuktāgama (SA-3) (雜阿含經) was made approximately CE 222–280 by an anonymous translator and consists of 27 sutras in one fascicle. In the Taishō edition of the Chinese canon, it is text number 101, located at T vol. 2, 493a.

[{"uid": "sn5.1", "root_name": "\u0100\u1e37avik\u0101sutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 5.1", "blurb": "The nun \u0100\u1e37avik\u0101 has entered the Dark Wood seeking seclusion when M\u0101ra comes to threaten her, claiming there is no escape and no point in seclusion. She recognizes him instantly and dismisses his taunts, asserting that she is beyond his control.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn5.2", "root_name": "Som\u0101sutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 5.2", "blurb": "When meditating in the Dark Wood, the nun Som\u0101 is taunted by M\u0101ra, who claims that a mere woman can never see the subtle truth. She rejects him, stating that gender does not matter when one is perceiving deep truths, and telling M\u0101ra to go see those still attached to gender.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn5.3", "root_name": "Kis\u0101gotam\u012bsutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 5.3", "blurb": "M\u0101ra taunts the nun Kis\u0101gotam\u012b, alleging she is mourning sons and longing for a man. She rejects him, stating that she has no need for men, as she has destroyed the mass of darkness and conquered the army of Death.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn5.4", "root_name": "Vijay\u0101sutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 5.4", "blurb": "M\u0101ra comes to the nun Vijay\u0101 in the form of a handsome youth and tries to tempt her from her path. But she rejects sensual pleasures, as she delights in subtle meditation and has ended ignorance.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn5.5", "root_name": "Uppalava\u1e47\u1e47\u0101sutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 5.5", "blurb": "Uppalava\u1e47\u1e47\u0101 is rebuked by M\u0101ra, who says a beautiful woman like her should fear rogues when alone in the forest. However, she dismisses such fears, saying she can use her psychic powers to defeat thousands of rogues like him.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn5.6", "root_name": "C\u0101l\u0101sutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 5.6", "blurb": "M\u0101ra asks the nun C\u0101l\u0101 why she disapproves of rebith. She replies that it necessarily entails suffering.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn5.7", "root_name": "Upac\u0101l\u0101sutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 5.7", "blurb": "M\u0101ra asks the nun Upac\u0101l\u0101 where she wishes to be reborn. But as the world everywhere is burning, she rejects all forms of rebirth.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn5.8", "root_name": "S\u012bsupac\u0101l\u0101sutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 5.8", "blurb": "M\u0101ra asks the nun S\u012bsupac\u0101l\u0101 whose teaching she believes in. She replies that she rejects the various sectarians and follows the Buddha, as his teachings lead to freedom.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn5.9", "root_name": "Sel\u0101sutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 5.9", "blurb": "M\u0101ra asks the nun Sel\u0101 about who has created this \u201cpuppet\u201d, i.e. the form that has been reincarnated. [{"uid": "ja376", "root_name": "Av\u0101riyaj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "Av\u0101riy\u0101\u2019s Father, The Foolish Ferryman ", "acronym": "Ja 376", "blurb": "\u201cNe\u2019er be angry, etc.\u201d The Master told this tale while dwelling at Jetavana, about a ferryman. This man, they say, was foolish and ignorant: he knew not the qualities of the Three Jewels and of all excellent beings: he was hasty, rough and violent. ", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja377", "root_name": "Setaketuj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "The Student Setaketu ", "acronym": "Ja 377", "blurb": "\u201cFriend, be not angry\u201d\u2014The Master told this tale at Jetavana, of a deceitful Brother. The occasion of the story will appear in the Uddala Birth. ", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja378", "root_name": "Dar\u012bmukhaj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "Dar\u012bmukha the Priest\u2019s Son ", "acronym": "Ja 378", "blurb": "\u201cPleasures of sense\u201d\u2014This tale was told by the Master while dwelling in Jetavana, concerning the Great Renunciation. The incident that led to the story has been told before.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja379", "root_name": "Neruj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "Mount Neru ", "acronym": "Ja 379", "blurb": "\u201cRavens and crows\u201d\u2014The Master told this tale in Jetavana concerning a certain Brother. The story is that he got the forms of meditation from the Master and then went to a frontier village. There the people, pleased with his deportment, fed him, built him a hut in the wood, and exacting a promise, made him live there, and gave him great honour. But they forsook him for the teachers of the permanence of matter, afterwards forsaking those for the sect who deny immortality, and those again for the sect of naked ascetics: for teachers of all these sects came among them in turn. ", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja380", "root_name": "\u0100sa\u1e45kaj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "The Lotus-Maiden Named Doubt ", "acronym": "Ja 380", "blurb": "\u201cIn heavenly garden\u201d\u2014The Master told this tale while dwelling at Jetavana, concerning the temptation of a Brother by his former wife. The occasion will appear in the Indriya Birth. The Master found that the brother was backsliding owing to thoughts of his wife, so he said, \u201cSir, this woman does you harm: formerly also for her sake you sacrificed an army of the four divisions and dwelt in the Himalaya three years in much misery\u201d: so he told an old tale.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja381", "root_name": "Mig\u0101lopaj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "Beast-Swiper the Vulture ", "acronym": "Ja 381", "blurb": "\u201cYour ways, my son\u201d\u2014The Master told this tale in Jetavana, of an unruly Brother. The Master asked the Brother, \u201cAre you really unruly?\u201d He said, \u201cYes, lord\u201d: and the Master saying, \u201cYou are not unruly for the first time; formerly too through unruliness you did not the bidding of the wise and met your death by the Verambha winds,\u201d told an old-world tale.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja382", "root_name": "Sirik\u0101\u1e37aka\u1e47\u1e47ij\u0101taka", "translated_name": "Lucky Unlucky ", "acronym": "Ja 382", "blurb": "\u201cWho is this\u201d\u2014The Master told this tale in Jetavana concerning Anathapindika. From the time when he was established in the fruition of the First Path he kept all the five first commandments unbroken; so also did his wife, his sons and daughters, his hired servants and his workpeople. One day in the Hall of Truth they began to discuss whether Anathapindika was pure in his walk and his household also. The Master came and was told their subject: so he said, \u201cBrethren, the wise men of old had pure households,\u201d and told an old tale.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja383", "root_name": "Kukku\u1e6daj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "The Chicken ", "acronym": "Ja 383", "blurb": "\u201cBird with wings\u201d\u2014The Master told this tale in Jetavana, concerning a Brother who longed for the world. The Master asked him, \u201cWhy do you long for the world?\u201d \u201cLord, through passion, for I saw a woman adorned.\u201d \u201cBrother, women are like cats, deceiving and cajoling to bring to ruin one who has come into their power,\u201d so he told an old tale.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja384", "root_name": "Dhammadhajaj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "A False Flag ", "acronym": "Ja 384", "blurb": "\u201cPractise virtue\u201d\u2014The Master told this tale while dwelling in Jetavana, of a deceitful Brother. He said, \u201cBrethren, this man is not deceitful now for the first time\u201d: so he told an old-world tale.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja385", "root_name": "Nandiyamigar\u0101jaj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "Nandiya, King of Deer ", "acronym": "Ja 385", "blurb": "\u201cWill you go to the King\u2019s Park\u201d\u2014The Master told this in Jetavana, of a Brother who supported his mother. He asked the Brother, \u201cIs it true that you support lay folk?\u201d \u201cYes, lord.\u201d \u201cWhat are they?\u201d \u201cMy father and mother, lord.\u201d \u201cWell done, well done, Brother: you keep up the rule of the wise men of old, for they too even when born as beasts gave their life for their parents,\u201d and so he told an old tale.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}]

[{"uid": "sn3.1", "root_name": "Daharasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 3.1", "blurb": "King Pasenadi meets the Buddha for the first time. He wonders how the Buddha can claim to be awakened when he is still so young. The Buddha teaches him four things that should not be looked down on for their youth.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "sn3.2", "root_name": "Purisasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 3.2", "blurb": "Pasenadi asks of the things that cause suffering when they arise in oneself.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "sn3.3", "root_name": "Jar\u0101mara\u1e47asutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 3.3", "blurb": "Pasenadi asks if anything that is born can escape from old age and death.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "sn3.4", "root_name": "Piyasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 3.4", "blurb": "Reporting on a reflection that arose while on retreat, Pasenadi says that those who do bad deeds treat themselves as enemy. The Buddha expresses his agreement in verse.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "sn3.5", "root_name": "Attarakkhitasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 3.5", "blurb": "Even if protected by an entire army, one who does bad deeds is still unprotected.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "sn3.6", "root_name": "Appakasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 3.6", "blurb": "There are few in the world who do not become negligent and complacent once they obtain material luxuries. ", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "sn3.7", "root_name": "A\u1e0d\u1e0dakara\u1e47asutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 3.7", "blurb": "Pasenadi laments how in his judgment hall he sees people lying all the time for the sake of sensual pleasures.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "sn3.8", "root_name": "Mallik\u0101sutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 3.8", "blurb": "Pasandi asks Queen Mallik\u0101 who is most dear. They both agree that the one most dear is oneself, and the Buddha agrees.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "sn3.9", "root_name": "Ya\u00f1\u00f1asutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 3.9", "blurb": "A great sacrifice involving the slaughter of many animals was being prepared for King Pasenadi. The Buddha condemns such sacrifices and says a fruitful sacrifice involves a blameless and harmless offering.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "sn3.10", "root_name": "Bandhanasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 3.10", "blurb": "When many people are put in chains by Pasenadi, the matter is reported to the Buddha.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}]

translated_name: The Chapter on Deeds of Substance
children: [{"uid": "an4.61", "root_name": "Pattakammasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "AN 4.61", "blurb": "Four things that are desirable, but hard to get; and how to get them through deeds of substance.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "an4.62", "root_name": "\u0100na\u1e47yasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "AN 4.62", "blurb": "The happiness of ownership, using wealth, debtlessness, and blamelessness.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "an4.63", "root_name": "Brahmasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "AN 4.63", "blurb": "A family where the children honor their parents in their home is said to live with Brahm\u0101.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "an4.64", "root_name": "Nirayasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "AN 4.64", "blurb": "Breaking precepts leads to hell.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "an4.65", "root_name": "R\u016bpasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "AN 4.65", "blurb": "Estimating others based on appearance, voice, austerity, and principle.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "an4.66", "root_name": "Sar\u0101gasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "AN 4.66", "blurb": "The greedy, the hateful, the delusional, and the conceited.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "an4.67", "root_name": "Ahir\u0101jasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "AN 4.67", "blurb": "Spreading loving-kindness to snakes and other creatures.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "an4.68", "root_name": "Devadattasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "AN 4.68", "blurb": "Possessions, honor, and popularity came to Devadatta for his own ruin and downfall.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "an4.69", "root_name": "Padh\u0101nasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "AN 4.69", "blurb": "The endeavors to restrain, to give up, to develop, and to preserve.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "an4.70", "root_name": "Adhammikasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "AN 4.70", "blurb": "Corruption of the realm follows corruption of the king.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}]

translated_name: The Chapter on the Satullapa Group
children: [{"uid": "sn1.31", "root_name": "Sabbhisutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 1.31", "blurb": "A series of deities give verses praising association with the good, and the Buddha gives his own response.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn1.32", "root_name": "Maccharisutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 1.32", "blurb": "A series of deities give verses praising generosity, and the Buddha gives his own response.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn1.33", "root_name": "S\u0101dhusutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 1.33", "blurb": "A series of deities give verses praising generosity, and the Buddha gives his own response, saying that practice of the Dhamma goes beyond this.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn1.34", "root_name": "Nasantisutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 1.34", "blurb": "Two deities exchange verses with the Buddha on how sensual pleasures give rise to suffering.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn1.35", "root_name": "Ujjh\u0101nasa\u00f1\u00f1isutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 1.35", "blurb": "Some deities come to find fault with the Buddha. He responds to their critique, which stimulates a further discussion on wrong-doing and forgiveness.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn1.36", "root_name": "Saddh\u0101sutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 1.36", "blurb": "A series of Satullapa gods address the Buddha with verses on various topics. The identifications of the verses in this unclear, and comparison with the Chinese parallels suggests the Pali may have suffered textual loss.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn1.37", "root_name": "Samayasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 1.37", "blurb": "A vast congregation of deities assembles to see the Buddha and the Sa\u1e45gha at Kapilavatthu.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn1.38", "root_name": "Sakalikasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 1.38", "blurb": "A series of deities praise the Buddha\u2019s resilience and composure when his foot is injured by a stone.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn1.39", "root_name": "Pa\u1e6dhamapajjunnadh\u012btusutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 1.39", "blurb": "A goddess identifying herself as Kokanada\u0304 claims to confirm with her own experience the Buddha\u2019s teachings on karma.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn1.40", "root_name": "Dutiyapajjunnadh\u012btusutta\u1e41", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 1.40", "blurb": "A goddess identified as Kokanada, possibly the sister of the previous, sums up the teaching in a pithy verse.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}]

[{"uid": "ja538", "root_name": "M\u016bgapakkhaj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "M\u016bgapakkha the Wise ", "acronym": "Ja 538", "blurb": "\u201cShew no intelligence\u201d\u2014This story the Master told at Jatavana concerning the great renunciation. One day the Brethren seated in the Hall of Truth were discussing the praises of the Blessed One\u2019s great renunciation. When the Master came and inquired of the Brethren what was the topic which they were discussing as they sat there, on hearing what it was, he said, \u201cNo, Brethren, this my renunciation of the world, after leaving my kingdom, was not wonderful, when I had fully exercised the perfections; for before, even when my wisdom was still immature, and while I was still attaining the perfections, I left my kingdom and renounced the world.\u201d And at their request he told them a story of the past.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja539", "root_name": "Mah\u0101janakaj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "The Longer Tale of King Janaka ", "acronym": "Ja 539", "blurb": "\u201cWho art thou, striving\u201d\u2014This story the Master, while dwelling at Jetavana, told concerning the great Renunciation. One day the Brethren sat in the Hall of Truth discussing the Tathagata\u2019s great Renunciation. The Master came and found that this was their subject; so he said \u201cThis is not the first time that the Tathagata performed the great Renunciation,\u2014he performed it also formerly.\u201d And herewith he told a story of the past.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja540", "root_name": "Suva\u1e47\u1e47as\u0101maj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "Golden S\u0101ma ", "acronym": "Ja 540", "blurb": "\u201cWho, as I filled\u201d\u2014This story the Master told at Jetavana, about a certain priest who supported his mother.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja541", "root_name": "Nimij\u0101taka", "translated_name": "Good King Nimi ", "acronym": "Ja 541", "blurb": "\u201cLo these grey hairs\u201d\u2014This story the Master told while dwelling in Makhadeva\u2019s mango park, near Mithila, about a smile. One day at eventide, the Master with a large company of Brethren was walking up and down in this mango park, when he espied a pleasant spot. Being desirous of telling his behaviour in former times, he allowed a smile to be seen on his face. When asked by the Reverend Ananda why he smiled, he answered, \u201cIn yonder spot, Ananda, I once dwelt, deep in ecstatic meditation, in the time of King Makhadeva.\u201d Then at his request, he sat down upon an offered seat, and told a story of the past.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja542", "root_name": "Uma\u1e45gaj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "The Great Tunnel ", "acronym": "Ja 542", "blurb": "\u201cKing Brahmadatta of Pancala\u201d\u2014The Teacher, while dwelling at Jetavana, told this about the perfection of knowledge.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja543", "root_name": "Bh\u016bridattaj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "Bhuridatta the Wise ", "acronym": "Ja 543", "blurb": "\u201cWhatever jewels there may be\u201d\u2014This story the Master told, while dwelling at Savatthi, about some lay-brethren who kept the fast-days.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja544", "root_name": "Candakum\u0101raj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "Prince Moon ", "acronym": "Ja 544", "blurb": "\u201cIn Pupphavati once there reigned\u201d\u2014The Teacher, while dwelling on the Gijjhakuta mountain, related this story concerning Devadatta. Its substance is contained in the section relating to the sin of causing schisms in the community; it is to be fully known by studying the Tathagata\u2019s conduct from his first becoming an ascetic down to the murder of King Bimbisara. ", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja545", "root_name": "Mah\u0101n\u0101radakassapaj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "The Great Tale of N\u0101rada Kassapa ", "acronym": "Ja 545", "blurb": "\u201cThere was a king of the Videhas\u201d\u2014This story was told by the Master, while dwelling in the Latthivana pleasure garden, in relation to the conversion of Uruvela-Kassapa.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja546", "root_name": "Vidhuraj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "Vidhura the Wise of Kuru ", "acronym": "Ja 546", "blurb": "\u201cThou art pale and thin and weak\u201d\u2014The Master told this tale while dwelling in Jetavana, concerning the Perfection of Wisdom.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}, {"uid": "ja547", "root_name": "Vessantaraj\u0101taka", "translated_name": "The Tale of Vessantara", "acronym": "Ja 547", "blurb": "\u201cTen boons\u201d\u2014This story the Master told while dwelling near Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Grove, about a shower of rain.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 1}]

[{"uid": "sn45.1", "root_name": "Avijj\u0101sutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 45.1", "blurb": "Following ignorance comes the wrong eightfold path. But the right eightfold path follows true knowledge.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn45.2", "root_name": "Upa\u1e0d\u1e0dhasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 45.2", "blurb": "When \u0100nanda says that good friendship is half the spiritual path, the Buddha rebukes him, saying that it is in fact the whole of the spiritual path. Based on good friendship, the eightfold path is fulfilled.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn45.3", "root_name": "S\u0101riputtasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 45.3", "blurb": "When S\u0101riputta says that good friendship is the whole of the spiritual path, the Buddha praises him. Based on good friendship, the eightfold path is fulfilled.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn45.4", "root_name": "J\u0101\u1e47usso\u1e47ibr\u0101hma\u1e47asutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 45.4", "blurb": "A\u0304nanda sees the brahmin Ja\u0304\u1e47usso\u1e47i resplendent on his all-white chariot. He asks the Buddha whether there is a similarly divine vehicle in Buddhism. The Buddha responds by drawing a detailed set of analogies between the eightfold path and a chariot.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn45.5", "root_name": "Kimatthiyasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 45.5", "blurb": "When asked what is the purpose of the spiritual path, you should answer that it is the ending of suffering.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn45.6", "root_name": "Pa\u1e6dhamaa\u00f1\u00f1atarabhikkhusutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 45.6", "blurb": "A mendicant asks what is the purpose of the spiritual path, and the Buddha answers that it is the ending of suffering.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn45.7", "root_name": "Dutiyaa\u00f1\u00f1atarabhikkhusutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 45.7", "blurb": "A mendicant asks about Nibb\u0101na and the deathless.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn45.8", "root_name": "Vibha\u1e45gasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 45.8", "blurb": "The Buddha presents the eightfold path together with a detailed analysis of each factor. It should be assumed that these explanations apply wherever the eightfold path is taught.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn45.9", "root_name": "S\u016bkasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 45.9", "blurb": "A mendicant with wrong view will develop the path in the wrong way, harming themselves as if grabbing a sharp spike the wrong way.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}, {"uid": "sn45.10", "root_name": "Nandiyasutta", "translated_name": null, "acronym": "SN 45.10", "blurb": "The wanderer Nandiya asks how many things lead to extinguishment.", "node_type": "leaf", "root_lang_iso": "pli", "root_lang_name": "P\u0101li", "child_range": null, "yellow_brick_road": true, "yellow_brick_road_count": 2}]

blurb: The Buddha’s teachings on meditation, morality, the nature of the world, and the path to freedom. These scriptures are our primary sources for the historical Buddha’s life and practice. They depict the Buddha and his students in lively conversation with a diverse range of people.

translated_name: Linked Discourses on the Unknowable Beginning
blurb: The “Linked Discourses on the Unknowable Beginning” contains 20 discourses that speak of how the ultimate origin of the process of transmigration (saṁsāra) is unknowable. This theme is a direct counter to the hubris of the creation myths found in most religions, which confidently recount events which are in fact permanently hidden from view. The Buddha emphasized that transmigration has been ongoing for a fathomless period of time, illustrating it with a series of powerful similes.

blurb: The “Linked Discourses with Lakkhaṇa” contains 21 discourses with the Buddha featuring the monk Lakkhaṇa (“Mark”). Through his psychic powers he sees beings in various states of torment and distress, and describes them to the Buddha.
